image.altText: An image of an SA Police officer's vest.

props.synopsis: The rate of suicide among serving police officers in Australia has more than doubled in the past decade, prompting calls for more open conversations about the impact the job can have on mental health. WARNING: This article contains content that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: 'All of a sudden I was in a really bad way': Advocates want a conversation on police mental health

image.altText: A Port Adelaide AFL player is hugged by a teammate (wearing #4) after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: A contrite Jeremy Finlayson admits he used a homophobic slur in Friday's match against Essendon, as the Power forward prepares to make a statement.

title.children: Port forward faces investigation after admitting to using a homophobic slur in Essendon clash

image.altText: A sign in front of a construction site.

props.synopsis: GJ Gardner Homes promises "peace of mind" and a high standard of workmanship. But for at least a year, customers have been urging the company to intervene over one of its franchisees — which has now gone under.

title.children: Despite promises of 'peace of mind', one GJ Gardner Homes franchisee infuriates customers

image.altText: ses personnel holds a woman in a boat as he rescues her from flood water

props.synopsis: More than 80 flood alerts are currently active across New South Wales in the wake of torrential rain across the state.

title.children: Hundreds isolated after floodwaters and damaged roads cut off communities

image.altText: Suns v Giants

props.synopsis: Gold Coast coach Damien Hardwick has unleashed the Suns' kids as they take on GWS in Mt Barker as a massive final day of Gather Round gets underway. Follow live.

title.children: Suns unveil prized recruits against flag-favourite Giants in Mt Barker on Gather Round Sunday

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: Giants lead the Suns by nine points
Three new Suns to get excited about

image.altText: A n american flag conceals the face of a bo walking with a gun in a holster on his jeans

props.synopsis: A birthday party in Chicago. A convenience store in New York. A public park in Atlanta. In a single day in the United States, all become the scenes of gun violence.

title.children: One day, seven mass shootings: This is what 24 hours of gun violence looks like across the US

image.altText: A man wearing blue hospital gown sits up while nurses in scrubs inspect his scalp

props.synopsis: Young men with heads swaddled in gauze wander through the streets, taking in the sights and sounds of Istanbul. But these aren't regular tourists — they have all come with the same singular mission: to find an antidote to their baldness.

title.children: Plucking and implanting thousands of hair follicles, one by one, these surgeons are 'selling confidence'

image.altText: An upended trampoline lies amid the branches of a large tree that has been felled by a storm.

props.synopsis: Terrified Green Point residents heard an "almighty roar" as a suspected waterspout made landfall in their street and essentially turned into a tornado.

title.children: Waterspout wreaks havoc after making landfall in NSW town

image.altText: Simon Birmingham press gallery doorstop

props.synopsis: Israel should learn from the killing of seven humanitarian workers, according to the Coalition's foreign affairs spokesperson Simon Birmingham.

title.children: Birmingham calls Gaza aid killing 'mistake', says Israel should 'look carefully' at procedures

image.altText: A large crowd of protesters carry Israeli flags, torches and signs saying "bring them home" and "hostage deal now"

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces pressure to resign as tens of thousands of protesters call for new elections six months into his military offensive to Gaza, where the UN warns of a looming famine.

title.children: Israelis call for Netanyahu's resignation as hunger grows in Gaza

image.altText: A man smiles with his son at an outdoor restaurant

props.synopsis: Jailed Australian man Robert Pether has penned an emotional letter from behind bars in Iraq, saying he feels "abandoned" by the Australian government and worried he will never get home.

title.children: 'Abandoned, sick and worried I won't survive': Australian jailed in Iraq urges country not to forget him

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Time to put your money where your mouth is and trust me, I'm hard to impress.

title.children: Talk a big game when it comes to quizzes? Try this then. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: Rutherglen truck crash

props.synopsis: Hundreds of trucks pass through Rutherglen every day and locals are losing hope that they will ever see a bypass built. Regardless, they say action needs to be taken as a matter of urgency.

title.children: Popular town on Victoria’s wine trail begs for bypass after serious smash and fatality

image.altText: A close up of the word 'POLICE' on a white car

props.synopsis: Police say an elderly man has died following a quad bike crash on a private property at Forest Range last night.

title.children: Man, 92, dies after quad bike crash on Adelaide Hills property

image.altText: A woman with brown wavy hair, wearing a brown shirt with a brown wall behind her smiles and balances her head on one hand

props.synopsis: After being diagnosed with a rare brain tumour in 2017, author and commentator Jamila Rizvi drew on the strength of her support network to stay upright. "Our narratives of illness are, in my view, too focused on stoicism and solitude," she says.

title.children: Jamila Rizvi on how to keep going in the face of illness

image.altText: A man in a green hooded jumper looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Elad Katzir was taken hostage on October 7 by Palestinian gunmen, and had pleaded for his release earlier this year.

title.children: 'Tell my family that I love them': Body of hostage recovered from Gaza by Israeli commandos

image.altText: A young Aboriginal man with a large smile

props.synopsis: More than three decades on, the circumstances surrounding the death of Gomeroi teen Mark Haines remain a mystery to his family. They hope this time, a coroner will give them answers.

title.children: Fresh inquest into baffling case of teen found dead on train tracks near Tamworth set to begin this week

image.altText: Bluey jumps in the air happily

props.synopsis: Bluey and her family are facing a potentially big life change. So, how can you prepare little ones and help them navigate when their world shifts? Here's what the experts say.

title.children: Bluey is back and facing a potentially big life change

image.altText: A WA Police badge on an officer's shirt shoulder.

props.synopsis: A group of people arrived by boat in Western Australia's northern Kimberley region on Friday, the ABC understands.

title.children: WA Police searching for man thought to have arrived in Australia with group on 'unknown vessel'

image.altText: A woman holds a white scruffy dog up to her face, church stained glass windows in background

props.synopsis: When miniature poodle Coccola's quality of life declined, Nadia knew it was time to book at-home euthanasia for her "soulmate". We follow the pair during their final days together.

title.children: 'My last act of love': Heartache laid bare as owners share last week before pets put to sleep

image.altText: Peter Brock with his son and partner

props.synopsis: The longtime partner of Peter Brock died after a years-long battle with cancer.

title.children: Bev Brock, partner of late racing champion, dies aged 77

image.altText: Jay Vine

props.synopsis: Jay Vine's Olympics hopes look all but dashed after it was confirmed the Australian faces six weeks in a neck brace after his horror crash in Spain.

title.children: Aussie cyclist Vine avoids surgery after shocking crash but faces six weeks in a neck brace

image.altText: Breiana Whitehead

props.synopsis: Breiana Whitehead claims the overall award at the Princess Sofia Regatta to boost her confidence ahead of a medal push at Paris 2024.

title.children: Olympics medal hopeful Whitehead gets confidence boost with Formula Kite victory at prestigious Spanish event

image.altText: A hand holding onto a small, white alarm clock

props.synopsis: Typically, smartphones will automatically reflect the change in time zone. But analogue clocks and some digital clocks — think microwaves and ovens — may need to be adjusted.

title.children: Daylight saving time ended this morning. Here's why your phone clock should have already wound back

image.altText: Police walking in the Alice Springs CBD.

props.synopsis: As Alice Springs residents wait to hear whether a two-week youth curfew will lift, there's an ongoing debate about what led to the unrest on the town's streets.

title.children: Crime in Alice Springs is nothing new. But how did it become an 'emergency situation'?

image.altText: A group of a dozen dancers in formation, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: For children living in the remote north-east Arnhem Land mining town of Nhulunbuy, 650 kilometres east of Darwin, dance is a passion but also a dream that's long felt out of reach.

title.children: From Arnhem Land to Disneyland: Remote kids pull out all stops for the performance of a lifetime

image.altText: A child stands next to a flooded road while a mother rides a bike with her baby.

props.synopsis: King tides are not new in Tuvalu, but February's reached areas that had not been flooded before, forcing some Tuvaluans to question how much time they had left in their home country.

title.children: 'How long before it totally disappears?': Tuvalu's king tides raise bleak question for island nation

image.altText: Pauly Fuemana wearing a black jacket and cravat points to the camera with a red convertible sports car behind him.

props.synopsis: Nearly 30 years after releasing an era-defining song, the Fuenama family are back in the spotlight with the reissue of a forgotten but seminal album.

title.children: How Bizarre: The family behind the 90s global sensation returns to the spotlight

image.altText: A tug boat pushes a large grey ship in water as a worker in a hard hat watches on from afar

props.synopsis: The naval drills come as tensions continue to rise between China and its neighbours in the disputed territory.

title.children: Australia and its allies to hold navy drills in the South China Sea for the first time as Beijing watches on

image.altText: An aerial photo of the ocean and beach in the foreground and houses along the coast

props.synopsis: House prices have risen dramatically across the Wide Bay region since 2020 but experts say they are still cheaper than homes in Australia's capital cities.

title.children: Homes in this pocket of coastal Queensland are still 'extraordinarily cheap' despite a price spike of more than 80pc

image.altText: A wooden salad bowl with tabouli and salad servers. Tomatoes, spring onions and herbs nearby.

props.synopsis: From a garden-fresh tabouli packed with parsley and mint and a flavourful caprese salad featuring basil and thyme, to a coriander-crusted cod and pesto salad, these dishes are all elevated thanks to humble herbs.

title.children: Four recipes to help you make the most of your home-grown herbs

image.altText: A young boy with curly hair sits in his kitchen surrounded by foood

props.synopsis: Ashton Osborne seems just like an average 10-year-old who loves to play soccer and hang out with his friends. But in his spare time, he's spurred on by a sense of social justice and has been raising thousands for Canberra's homeless.

title.children: 'He's a little rock in a pond': Ashton's emergency food packs are helping Canberra's homeless

image.altText: A small furry creature perched on a human finger

props.synopsis: Most Australians will never have heard of the kakarratul, an elusive silky mole that burrows in the desert and has no eyes. Now a growing threat is shrinking its habitat.

title.children: 'No April Fools joke!' Rare pic of blind mole captured in outback
